body.p: Before 2010, the Board and the FASB had planned to complete the project in eight separate phases, but completed only one phase—on objectives and qualitative characteristics. On restarting the project in 2012, the Board decided to develop a complete set of proposals for a revised Conceptual Framework instead of continuing with the phased approach. Developing the Conceptual Framework as a whole enabled the Board and stakeholders to see more clearly the links between different aspects of the Conceptual Framework.
